intro: Cordylanthus wrightii, commonly known as Wright's curlcup, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive curled leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It has a deep root system that helps it survive in poor soil conditions. Cordylanthus wrightii is often found in open woodlands and scrublands, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
